data.title: Peter Facinelli, Lance Henriksen on their film 'On Fire'
data.meta_description: In an interview with Spectrum News, Peter Facinelli said the movie has many takeaways, and one of those is to celebrate the heroism of firefighters.
data.text:
LOS ANGELES â âOn Fireâ is inspired by actual events and tells the story of a man and his familyâs fight for survival as a devastating wildfire rips through their homeâs surrounding countryside.

In an interview with Spectrum News, Peter Facinelli said the movie has many takeaways, one of which is to celebrate the heroism of firefighters.

âThe film also celebrates our 911 operators, first responders. They donât get a lot of credit. It was a little in-depth look at how stressful their job is and how they have to have these experiences where someoneâs life is on the line, and they canât always help them. They have to stuff that down so they can help the next person, and the next person,â he said.

Facinelli is co-director of âOn Fire,â because when director Nick Lyon had COVID during the filming, Facinelli stepped into the directorâs chair.

"To Nickâs credit, he trusted me and believed I understood what we were trying to make together enough to say, 'here is the torch, carry it through,'" he said.

Lance Henriksen, who also stars in âOn Fire,â said he hopes the theme of family resonates with viewers.

Henriksen told Spectrum News he felt blessed with the cast.

âThey were all good, and they let me be good,â he said.

The film also stars Asher Angel and Fiona Dourif.

SAG-AFTRA approved an interim agreement for âOn Fireâ because the film was released by Cineverse, an independent, non-AMPTP affiliated distributor. Under the terms, members âmay work on these productions without being in violation of the strike order,â according to the guild.

The movie's team expressed gratitude to SAG-AFTRA for allowing the cast to promote the film.

âOn Fireâ is now playing in theaters.
